page.title: 15Mary Deans School
page.content: Mary Dean was the founder of our school.She set up a Charity School in a house she bought in Tamerton Foliot in 1720.The school was not endowed until her death in October 1734. Last year we celebrated the 250th anniversary of her death and our headmaster and the chairman of the governers laid a wreath on her grave at Bickleigh Church. The school remained in Mary Dean's house for 140 years.Mary Dean said that there were to be"Twenty poor boys from the parish,and no more",and they were to be taught to read and write, to learn arithmetic, and to be instructed in their principles of the Christian religion. The school moved to Rock Hill School in 1870 to provide more places. Our new school was opened in 1975. Gillian Maitland.
